General Usage

Language-specific text highlighting is implemented with prism.js. To embed a code snippet in Gymnasium content, wrap it in <pre> and <code> tags and specify the language for syntax highlighting.

Fenced Code Blocks

This code snippet:

<pre>
    <code class="language-javascript">
    function myTestFunction(x,y) {
        return x * y;
    }
    </code>
</pre>

Would appear like this in Gymnasium:

    function myTestFunction(x,y) {
        return x * y;
    }

Inline Code

Inline code snippets work the same way - simply remove any extraneous whitespace. For example, this snippet:

You can use <pre><code class="language-javascript">console.log()</code></pre> to debug your code!

Would appear like this in Gymnasium:

You can use console.log() to debug your code!

To embed a code snippet in a multiple choice problem you wrap it in <pre> and <code> tags and specify the language for syntax highlighting.

<pre>
    <code class="language-css">
    body {
        margin: 0
    }
    </code>
</pre>

Using Code in Assessments

This section is incomplete!

Example of a standard multiple choice problem:

>>1. Select a choice below. The correct answer should be very evident.<<
     ( ) incorrect
     ( ) impossible
     (x) correct 
     ( ) inaccurate

[explanation]
This is a helpful explanation of the correct answer.
[explanation]

Example using code snippets for answer choices:

>>1. Select a choice below. The correct answer should be very evident.<<
     ( ) <pre><code class="language-javascript">printf.out()</code></pre>
     ( ) <pre><code class="language-javascript">serial.write()</code></pre>
     (x) <pre><code class="language-javascript">console.log()</code></pre>
     ( ) <pre><code class="language-javascript">output.send()</code></pre>

[explanation]
This is a helpful explanation of the correct answer.
[explanation]
